conclusion: To determine the heat exchanged, analyze each segment of the cycle using the first law of thermodynamics.
Net heat exchange for a cyclic process is equal to the net work done by the system.
Work done by the gas during a cyclic process is the area enclosed by the cycle on the p-V diagram.
Segment AB is an isobaric process with pressure P2 and volume change V2 - V1.
Work done during segment AB is W_AB = P2 * (V2 - V1).
Segment BC is an isochoric process with volume V2 and pressure change P2 - P1.
Work done during segment BC is W_BC = 0.
Segment CD is an isobaric process with pressure P1 and volume change V1 - V2.
Work done during segment CD is W_CD = P1 * (V1 - V2).
Segment DA is an isochoric process with volume V1 and pressure change P1 - P2.
Work done during segment DA is W_DA = 0.
Net work done W_net is the sum of work done in each segment.
Using the first law of thermodynamics, Q_net = W_net.
The amount of heat exchanged is (P2 - P1)(V2 - V1).
